RTV2100 - Writing for the Electronic Med.name: RTV2100 - Writing for the Electronic Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practical experience in writing for various electronic media including radio, television, corporate, and digital media. Scripting requirements, writing styles and creative applications.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

RTV3007 - Development and Structure of E.name: RTV3007 - Development and Structure of Electronic Media and New Technology

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SPC 1608 or SPC 1603C or COM 1000 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Nature of the media, the mechanics of operation of analog and digital systems, history, economics, programming, and internal and external controls.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Journalism major and a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in JOU 2100C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Newswriting and newsgathering skills and strategies and their accompanying ethical considerations for analog and digital delivery of broadcast journalism.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Journalism major, and a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in RTV 3301 and RTV 3321 or C. I.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Journalism major, and a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in RTV 3301 and RTV 3321 or C. I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Newswriting and newsgathering strategies learned in RTV 3301 are integrated into a newsgathering context for actual production of analog and digital radio and television news packages.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: JOU 2100 and status as either an RTV or Journalism major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the profession and video news. Students plan, research, report, write and execute electronic news productions from concept to finished product.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

RTV3511 - Production Fundamentals and Ae.name: RTV3511 - Production Fundamentals and Aesthetics of Electronic Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Either SPC 1608, SPC 1603, or COM 1000, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Technical and creative concepts of analog and digital electronic media production for radio, television, and multimedia delivery systems.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Technical and aesthetic requirements of analog and digital single-camera video production, including techniques for electronic news gathering (ENG) and electronic field production (EFP). Students should expect significant work in the RTV facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analog and digital television studio production including audio mixers, microphones, tape recorders, cameras, video switchers, lighting, and electronic graphics. Significant work in RTV facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV 3511 and RTV Major- Production Specialization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Audio production theory & recording techniques utilizing various microphone types, & digital non-linear audio computer-based editing equipment. Significant work in RTV facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV 3531 and RTV Major - Production Specialization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced post-production techniques for analog and digital video, including A/B roll time code editing, digital video effects, electronic graphics, and non-linear video.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: RTV 3007 and RTV 3511 and RTV major

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic theories and conventions applied to editing video and audio, and the role of the editor in visual storytelling.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: RTV 3543C or RTV 3531C, and RTV Major - Production Specialization

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV 3543C or RTV 3531C, and RTV Major - Production Specialization

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic lighting techniques for both studio and location, single and multiple-camera video production. Students should expect significant work in the RTV facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: CGS 1060C; major status in R-TV, Ad-PR, Journalism, Organizational and Interpersonal Communication.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practice and production of electronic interactive multimedia for the broadcast industry. Students should expect significant work in the RTV facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV Major or JOU Major, Junior standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of performance skills and techniques required to be a performer in any area of broadcast television and performing industry, with emphasis on announcing, interviewing, reporting, auditioning, performance in scenes and commercials. Expect extensive studio work in the RTV facility outside the class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: C.I., RTV Major, and either RTV 3556C, RTV 3543C, or RTV 3531.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student will serve in some position of responsibility for UCF Weekly News or other RTV program.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: How people process mass media messages, and in turn, what effects they have on individuals.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

RTV4403 - Electronic Media, Technology,.name: RTV4403 - Electronic Media, Technology, and Society

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theories of mass communication, mass communication effects, and emerging communication technologies, including digital media.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Radio Television major and RTV 3007 or CI

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Audience research applied in broad range of media industries including broadcasting and social media.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

RTV4503 - Sports Programming in Electron.name: RTV4503 - Sports Programming in Electronic Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Either SPC 1608, COM 1000, RTV 3007, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Factors that determine how sporting events are constructed for programming on broadcast stations, cable television, and other forms of electronic media.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

RTV4505 - Program Issues for TV & Motion.name: RTV4505 - Program Issues for TV & Motion Pictures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of program development theories, strategies and issues in the television and motion picture industries. Students should expect significant work in the RTV lab facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: RTV 3531,  RTV3576C , RTV 3543C and departmental consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced techniques in production and directing television programs and video projects both in-studio and on-location.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV 3511 and RTV Major - Production or Media Management & Operations specialization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study and production of current radio formats, the integration of digital resources, and their effects on today's radio listener. Students should expect significant work in the RTV lab facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Presentation of broadcast material on web. Integrates the distribution of radio, television, & web content. Significant work in the RTV lab facility outside of class.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Journalism major, C.I. or
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
RTV3304 - Electronic Journalism II (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Weekly campus newscast production. Daily newsgathering/production conducted by students under advisement of instructor functioning as news director. Significant work in RTV lab outside classroom.

Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: RTV Major or Mass Comm. minor, and RTV 3007.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Federal, state, local and self-regulatory agencies and practices which govern electronic media.

Department.text: Nicholson School of Communication and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of broadcast management problems in station operations at local, regional, and national levels.
